answers.answer: Probably worth getting a second opinion.With the throat symptoms, acid reflux (even w/o symptoms of heartburn) is more likely cause than thyroid enlargement.  And - "enlargement" on ultrasound may be a technical measurement difference and not a true enlargement.Try to see an endocrinologist who does ultrasound in the office -- that way you will get most of your answers the first visit.

question: My endo has taken a wait and see approach.  At most recent appointment I learned that he did not order thyroid testing, but lots of Diabetic work up which was normal.  I have no history of Diabetes in family but there are thyroid issues.  I explained that symptoms are more problematic esp the choking feeling in my throat.  I can live with the dry skin, joint pain up and down fatigue levels, etc but not if I can't breathe.  I've had several choking episodes eating and now with even drinking water. Gastroeterologist did a scope and found nothing to cause this and suggested thyroid involvement.  Based on that he decided to do ultra sound of thyroid and lo and behold it has 'grown' since my last appt 3 mo ago.  He says it's large but there is nothing to be done but watch it and wait for it 'to die and atrophy'.  there are nodules but he thinks they are stable.  Can this be correct that I just need to wait for the gland to die?  What about thyroid production?  Don't I need that?  He doesn't want to see me for 4 months and gave me a lab slip for again, diabetic testing, and T4 and TSH only.    I was too stunned to say much.  I'd appreciate your input, I've learned a lot reading the questions and answers.  Thanks!
title: Stumped/stunned by doc's reaction
